title: 107_s2893
content:
SECTION 1. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, definitions include terms like "Agreement" referring to a specific agreement between Pueblo of Santa Clara and Pueblo of San Ildefonso, "boundary line" established under section 4(a), "Governors" representing the leaders of the respective pueblos, "Indian tribe" as defined in the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act, and "Pueblos" referring to the specific pueblos mentioned. The term "Pueblos" in this Act refers to the Pueblo of Santa Clara and the Pueblo of San Ildefonso in New Mexico. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior, and "trust land" means land held by the United States in trust under specific sections. Trust for the Pueblo of Santa Clara, New Mexico. The United States holds land in trust for the Pueblo of Santa Clara, New Mexico, including 2,484 acres in Rio Arriba County, New Mexico. This land consists of specific sections in the New Mexico Principal Meridian. The United States holds land in trust for the Pueblo of Santa Clara, New Mexico, including specific sections in T. 20 N., R. 7 E., Sec. 25, 26, 27, and T. 20 N., R. 8 E., Sec. 19, 30, excluding certain tracts owned by the Pueblo of San Ildefonso. The United States holds land in trust for the Pueblo of Santa Clara, New Mexico, excluding certain tracts owned by the Pueblo of San Ildefonso. The United States holds land in trust for the Pueblo of San Ildefonso, New Mexico, consisting of approximately 2,000 acres in Rio Arriba County and Santa Fe County. The United States holds land in trust for the Pueblo of San Ildefonso, New Mexico, which includes specific portions of land located south of a boundary line in T. 20 N., R. 7 E., Sec. 27, 34, and 35 of the New Mexico Principal Meridian, excluding the San Ildefonso Pueblo Grant. SEC. 4. SURVEY AND LEGAL DESCRIPTIONS. The Office of Cadastral Survey will complete a survey to establish boundaries of trust land. The Secretary will publish legal descriptions of the boundary line and trust land in the Federal Register. Technical corrections can be made before publication. Beginning on the date of publication in the Federal Register, the legal descriptions of trust land boundaries will be official and consistent with the Agreement. SEC. 5. ADMINISTRATION OF TRUST LAND. Beginning on the date of enactment of this Act, the land held in trust under section 2(a) will become part of the Santa Clara Indian Reservation, and the land held in trust under section 3(a) will become part of the San Ildefonso Indian Reservation. The trust land will be administered in accordance with applicable laws and regulations for property held in trust by the United States for Indian tribes, including the Pueblo Lands Act. The land owned or acquired by the Pueblo of Santa Clara and Pueblo of San Ildefonso in their respective grants will be held in trust for traditional uses or conservation. Criteria for land use will be developed in collaboration with the Pueblos. The trust land owned by the Pueblo of Santa Clara and Pueblo of San Ildefonso will be preserved for traditional uses or conservation. Criteria for land use will be established to ensure stewardship and limit new commercial developments. SEC. 6. EFFECT.

This Act does not affect existing rights or interests in trust land, including rights-of-way, leases, permits, mining claims, grazing permits, water rights, or other interests held by individuals or entities before the enactment of this Act. It also does not impact the Pueblos' rights to land based on Aboriginal or Indian title, existing water rights, or constitute a reservation of water rights on trust land.
